    ans += (long long)i * q * (q +1) / 2;

}

The C program will:

1. Read n from stdin.

2. Compute ans as per first program.

3. Convert ans to a string, get first character, add 1 → c.

4. Determine that the input to third step is a single character, so oddCount is 1.

Therefore, the code can be written as:

#include <stdio.h>
#include <string.h>

int main() {
    int n;
    scanf("%d", &n);
    long long ans = 0;
    for (int i = 1; i <= n; i++) {
        int q = n / i;
        ans += (long long)i * q * (q + 1) / 2;
    }
    char str_ans[20];
    sprintf(str_ans, "%lld", ans);
    char c = str_ans[0] + 1;
    // Now process third step's logic
    int oddCount = 1; // since input is a single character
    if (oddCount <= 1 || oddCount % 2 != 0) {
        printf("First\n");
    } else {
        printf("Second\n");
    }
    return 0;
}
